intro: Homalium molle var. rhodesicum, commonly known as the Rhodesian beauty, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains one or two seeds.
